title: How to Make a Bunny Baby Basket

steps.headline: Place the two towels together length ways to form a square.
steps.description: Roll them diagonally into the center.

steps.headline: Fold the rolled length in half.
Halfway down, as shown, place a piece of elastic or rubber band around it to secure it in place.
steps.description: The rounded section forms the body of the bunny and the two loose ends that a remain form the ears.

steps.headline: Fold the ear section back onto the body to form the head and secure it with elastic.
To make the ears pointy, take a wire coat hanger and form it into a v shape.
Push the wire into the back of the ears and bend the hanger hook underneath the bunny.
steps.description: Pin the ear fabric around the wire to hold them up. (It's a little like a hem around the wire).

steps.headline: Add the "wobble eyes" either with glue or  double sided tape (so it can be removed later).
Finish the bunny  by tying the ribbon around the head.

text: Place the two towels together length ways to form a square. Roll them diagonally into the center. Fold the rolled length in half.  Halfway down, as shown, place a piece of elastic or rubber band around it to secure it in place. The rounded section forms the body of the bunny and the two loose ends that a remain form the ears. Fold the ear section back onto the body to form the head and secure it with elastic.  To make the ears pointy, take a wire coat hanger and form it into a v shape.  Push the wire into the back of the ears and bend the hanger hook underneath the bunny. Pin the ear fabric around the wire to hold them up. (It's a little like a hem around the wire). Add the "wobble eyes" either with glue or  double sided tape (so it can be removed later).  Finish the bunny  by tying the ribbon around the head.
